Exaggerate: The claim may exaggerate the extent of John McCain's position change on invading Iraq.
Understate: The claim may understate or downplay any potential changes in John McCain's position on invading Iraq.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to prove that John McCain has changed his position on invading Iraq.
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that John McCain's position on invading Iraq has changed without providing concrete evidence or examples.
Exist alternative explanation: There may be alternative explanations for any perceived changes in John McCain's position on invading Iraq that are not explored in the claim.
